item.title: Being a Grafanista: a look from inside
item.description: Saturday, 2pm. Kids are sleeping. Wife is sleeping. Had to stop preparing for the upcoming travel to make sure the rest of the family can rest in absolute silence. Looks the right time to take a break and sit down to write a piece. I have a short time and lot to say, so forgive me if the form is not perfect and let’s focus on content!

item.title: Zen and Development | Potemkin Life
item.description: Good software engineers are rare. There are many reasons as to why. The most obvious reason is that to become a good software developer one has to master many skills (language proficiency, documentation literacy, debugging, text editing, architecture, and design, etc, etc). Because these are the obvious barriers to becoming good, there is an abundance of advice out there for young engineers on how to hone their skills. Most of this advice is either uninteresting, inefficient, or both. Why? Because the process of mastering a skill is typically independent of the skill being mastered. The process is almost always as simple as: learn (read technical material), practice (daily), have patience.

item.title: How to build mini high voltage Jacob's Ladder
item.description:
Today's build is really simple but really cool looking miniature high voltage Jacob's ladder. In this video we assemble "15KV high voltage generator kit", get some basic working principles about Jacob's ladder and maybe some more general tips and tricks. Heart of the build is cheap 15KV high voltage generator kit, i bought it online for about 1.5.- USD. Total budget on parts was around 2..3USD :) You can run it on single 18650 battery but i chose dc jack (At the moment the prices of batteries are too high).
Intro: (0:00) Working principle: (0:28) Parts: (0:41) Kit assembly: (0:51) Step-up transformer: (2:23) Kit test: (3:33) Enclosure: (3:52) Copper wire: (4:26) Soldering: (5:17) Assembly: (6:46) Outro: (8:04)
Step by step guide: --------------------------------------------------------- https://www.instructables.com/id/Mini-High-Voltage-Jacobs-Ladder/
Here are the main components i used for this build: --------------------------------------------------------- High voltage generator kit - https://www.aliexpress.com/item/32968528180.html?spm=a2g0s.9042311.0.0.27424c4d1FbJ5f Momentary push button - https://www.aliexpress.com/item/32850618919.html?spm=a2g0s.9042311.0.0.27424c4dYGrDbZ DC jack - https://www.aliexpress.com/item/32973509798.html?spm=a2g0s.9042311.0.0.27424c4dIHBi6m Ring Crimp Terminals/Connectors - https://www.aliexpress.com/item/32697753272.html?spm=a2g0s.9042311.0.0.27424c4dhXE4y5 Pin Screw Terminal - https://www.aliexpress.com/item/4000935638574.html?spm=2114.12010615.8148356.6.10646d58wsJZpr
Scrapped copper wire, plastic lids, some nuts and bolts. ---------------------------------------------------------
Caution! High voltage can be deadly! This project is not a toy, do not built his project without prior knowledge of electrical or fire safety. Do not touch or correct output wires while device is powered. All videos are shot using smartphone Xiaomi mi k20/t9.
Thank you for your view, i hope you liked my video and learned something new! Feel free to share, comment, like and subscribe:)
item.author: (Inspired Studio)
